content.question: The molar solubility of <math alttext="P b I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PbI</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="1 times 10 to the exponent of negative 3 molar" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </msup> <mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>M</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>. Which of the following is the best estimate for the value of <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="P b I 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>PbI</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 times 10 to the exponent of negative 6" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="2 times 10 to the exponent of negative 6" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>6</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="1 times 10 to the exponent of negative 9" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

<math alttext="4 times 10 to the exponent of negative 9" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 times 10 to the exponent of negative 9" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>9</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
